tr.tran: a person who lacks good judgment
a person who is gullible and easy to take advantage of
a professional clown employed to entertain a king or nobleman in the middle ages
make a fool or dupe of

examples: The bored children were fooling about

sentence-pair.sentence: Be ready when you' re discharged, you fool of fools
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: Be ready when you' re discharged, you fool of fools
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Berkemaslah setelah sembuh, hei ' Bodoh Terhebat '
sentence-pair.translation: Berkemaslah setelah sembuh, hei ' Bodoh Terhebat '
sentence-pair.speech-text: Be ready when you' re discharged, you fool of fools

sentence-pair.sentence: What then is the difference, the distinction, between the fool and the sage?
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: What then is the difference, the distinction, between the fool and the sage?
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Apakah perbedaan, kesenjangan, antara si dungu dan si bijaksana?
sentence-pair.translation: Apakah perbedaan, kesenjangan, antara si dungu dan si bijaksana?
sentence-pair.speech-text: What then is the difference, the distinction, between the fool and the sage?

sentence-pair.sentence: Nicolaus Copernicus was called a fool, but his accomplishments have affected modern thinking.
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: Nicolaus Copernicus was called a fool, but his accomplishments have affected modern thinking.
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Nikolaus Kopernikus disebut dungu, tetapi prestasinya mempengaruhi pemikiran modern.
sentence-pair.translation: Nikolaus Kopernikus disebut dungu, tetapi prestasinya mempengaruhi pemikiran modern.
sentence-pair.speech-text: Nicolaus Copernicus was called a fool, but his accomplishments have affected modern thinking.

sentence-pair.sentence: Therefore, with the breaking up of the body, the fool passes on to a [new] body.
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: Therefore, with the breaking up of the body, the fool passes on to a [new] body.
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Oleh karena itu dengan hancurnya jasmani, si dungu berlanjut pada tubuh [yang baru].
sentence-pair.translation: Oleh karena itu dengan hancurnya jasmani, si dungu berlanjut pada tubuh [yang baru].
sentence-pair.speech-text: Therefore, with the breaking up of the body, the fool passes on to a [new] body.

sentence-pair.sentence: German theologian Martin Luther lamented: “The fool will upset the whole science of astronomy.”
sentence-pair.taged-sentence: German theologian Martin Luther lamented: “The fool will upset the whole science of astronomy.”
sentence-pair.taged-translation: Teolog Jerman, Martin Luther, menyayangkan, ”Si dungu itu akan mengacaukan seluruh ilmu astronomi.”
sentence-pair.translation: Teolog Jerman, Martin Luther, menyayangkan, ”Si dungu itu akan mengacaukan seluruh ilmu astronomi.”
sentence-pair.speech-text: German theologian Martin Luther lamented: “The fool will upset the whole science of astronomy.”

sentence-pair.sentence: What fooling around?
sentence-pair.translation: Main- main apanya?
sentence-pair.speech-text: What fooling around?

sentence-pair.sentence: Stop fooling around, Allan.
sentence-pair.translation: Jangan main-main, Allan.
sentence-pair.speech-text: Stop fooling around, Allan.

sentence-pair.sentence: Stop fooling around
sentence-pair.translation: Jangan bermain- main
sentence-pair.speech-text: Stop fooling around

sentence-pair.sentence: You can’t just fool around.
sentence-pair.translation: Anda tidak bisa hanya main-main.
sentence-pair.speech-text: You can’t just fool around.

trs.i: n. orang bodoh; orang gila; orang goblok; orang gobrok;
v. main-main; bermain-main; berolok-olok; mempermain-mainkan; membodohi; memperbodoh;

sent.source: CNN: Former Klansman who apologized for racist past dies
sent.foreign: And Elwin Wilson didn't want to be a fool.

sent.source: BBC: Premier League fine awaits Blackpool - Mick McCarthy
sent.foreign: More fool you Mick, because I believe I can.

sent.source: CNN: Commentary: Black men must reclaim our children
sent.foreign: We also should be telling black women not to lie down with any fool.

tran_entry.tran: If you call someone a fool, you are indicating that you think they are not at all sensible and show a lack of good judgment
(formerly) a professional jester living in a royal or noble household
a dessert made from a purée of fruit with cream or custard

sent.eng_sent: What a damn fool thing to do!

tran_entry.tran: Fool is used to describe an action or person that is not at all sensible and shows a lack of good judgment

sent.eng_sent: Art dealers fool a lot of people.
Don't be fooled by his appearance.

tran_entry.tran: If someone fools you, they deceive or trick you

sent.eng_sent: What are you doing fooling with such a staggering sum of money?

tran_entry.tran: If you say that a person is fooling with something or someone, you mean that the way they are behaving is likely to cause problems

sent.eng_sent: Your brother is making a fool of you.

tran_entry.tran: If you make a fool of someone, you make them seem silly by telling people about something stupid that they have done, or by tricking them

sent.eng_sent: He was drinking and making a fool of himself.

tran_entry.tran: If you make a fool of yourself, you behave in a way that makes other people think that you are silly or lacking in good judgment

sent.eng_sent: They used to play the fool together, calling each other silly names and giggling.

tran_entry.tran: If you play the fool or act the fool, you behave in a playful, childish, and foolish way, usually in order to make other people laugh

summarys.summary: Libreville Leon M'ba International Airport (IATA: LBV, ICAO: FOOL) is an airport situated in Libreville, Gabon. It is the main international airport in the country.
